boxed-text.title: Did you know that
boxed-text.p: . . . 43% of public school parents think that the biggest problem that the public schools of their community must deal with is lack of financial support.
. . . 62% of the public say that they would be willing to pay more taxes to provide funds to improve the quality of the nation’s urban public schools.
. . . 53% of the public believes that the common core standards will help make education in the United States more competitive globally.
. . . 75% of the public believes that having common core standards will provide more consistency in the quality of education between school districts and states.
. . . 50% of the public believes that the common core standards will improve the quality of education in their community.
. . . 91% of the public school parents strongly agree that their child will graduate from high school.
. . . 38% of the public school parents strongly agree that their child will find a good job after he or she graduates.
. . . 27% of the public school parents strongly agree that their child’s teacher makes schoolwork relevant with real-world examples.
. . . 27% of the public school parents strongly agree that their child has the opportunity to do what he or she does best every day.
. . . 89% of the public believes it is very to somewhat important to close the academic achievement gap between White students and Black and Hispanic students.
. . . 84% of the public believes that the achievement gap can be narrowed substantially while maintaining high standards for all children.
. . . 70% of the public believes that the quality of the education provided by the public schools in their state differs from school district to school district.
. . . 71% of the public has trust and confidence in the men and women who are teaching children in the public schools.
. . . 57% of the public believes that entrance requirements into college teacher preparation programs should be more rigorous.
. . . 67% of the public believes that if the entrance requirements into a college teacher preparation program were more rigorous, more effective teachers would graduate from that college.
. . . 52% of the public believes that teacher evaluations should include how well a teacher’s students perform on standardized tests.
. . . 48% of the public would give the public schools in their community an A or B.
. . . 77% of public school parents would give the school their oldest child attends an A or B.
. . . 66% of the public favors the idea of charter schools.
. . . 44% of the public favors allowing students and parents to choose a private school to attend at public expense.
Statistics are from Bushaw, W. J., & Lopez, S. J. (2012). The 44th annual Phi Delta Kappa/Gallup Poll of the public’s attitudes toward the public schools. Phi Delta Kappan, 94(1), 9-25.
